issues.title: Budget Daily
issues.subtitle: A front-page digest of the most useful budgeting reads this week.
issues.tagline: Curated by the Super.com employees and the people who use it.
issues.sidebarNote: Happy 2026 and welcome to the inaugural issue of Budget Daily, our new front-page digest of budgeting stories designed to help you start the year with clarity and confidence.

callout.title: Try This Next
callout.text: Choose one action today: cancel one subscription, negotiate one bill, or automate a small weekly transfer to savings.

items.headline: Why Most Budgets Fail
items.subhead: And how to make yours work.
items.snippet: A realistic budget isn’t a set-it-and-forget-it document. Learn the common failure points and the mindset shifts that keep your plan working even when life changes.

photo.caption: A simple reset can unlock progress.

items.headline: Getting Started with Your Budget
items.subhead: A gentle guide to understanding income, expenses, and categories.
items.snippet: A quick refresher: set up categories, track the big rocks, and build a plan you can actually follow week to week.

items.headline: Zero-Based Budgeting
items.snippet: Zero-based budgeting helps you stay intentional by assigning every dollar a purpose. It can be especially powerful when money feels tight.

photo.caption: A proven baseline you can customize.

items.headline: Budgeting for Your First Apartment
items.subhead: Avoid common pitfalls when moving out.
items.snippet: Rent is only the start. Plan for utilities, deposits, move-in costs, and furnishing so your first place feels exciting—not financially stressful.

items.headline: How to Reduce Your Monthly Bills
items.subhead: Cut recurring expenses without sacrificing quality of life.
items.snippet: If your budget feels squeezed, recurring bills are the fastest place to find breathing room. Use a short checklist and do one negotiation at a time.

photo.caption: Small changes can add up quickly.

issues.footerNote: Publisher tip: keep snippets to 2–4 lines. Use 1–2 images per issue to pull attention to the lead story.
